page.title: 12BROCKWEIR BRIDGE
page.content: Brockweir bridge which is affecti- onately known as the 'Gateway to the Wye Valley'is to undergo major repairs in the Spring of 1986.The County Surveyor had planned to close the bridge during this Summer but fifty villagers and local hoteliers protest- ed,as the village depends on tourism in the Summer.Thework has been postpo- ned until next Spring. The bridge which was built in 1906 is an iron structure.The cost of the repairs is Â£180,000 and will be met by Gloucestershire and Gwent County Coun- cils.The carriageway will be reduced to a single lane for six months then completely closed for six months.A new waterproof membrane will be placed under the road surface during fair weather.The surveyors hope to keep inconvenience down to a minimum as do the villagers.
